skill.name: stripe-integration
skill.description: Implement Stripe payment processing for robust, PCI-compliant payment flows including checkout, subscriptions, and webhooks. Use when integrating Stripe payments, building subscription systems, or implementing secure checkout flows.
skill.summary: Implement Stripe payment processing for robust, PCI-compliant payment flows including checkout, subs...

security_audit.summary: The skill content is documentation and code examples only. No file access, environment access, or network exfiltration behavior is present.

content.user_title: Implement Stripe payments with clear patterns
content.value_statement: Setting up Stripe flows can be confusing and error prone. This skill provides ready patterns for checkout, subscriptions, and secure webhooks.
actual_capabilities: Provide payment intent flow with client secret handling
Provide subscription creation flow with invoice expansion
Provide webhook verification and event handling steps
Provide customer and payment method management patterns
Provide refund and dispute handling guidance
limitations: Does not execute Stripe API calls
Does not configure deployment or hosting
Does not create database schemas or migrations
Does not manage secrets storage for you

use_cases.title: Launch paid plan
use_cases.description: Set up subscription checkout and webhook confirmation for a new SaaS plan.

use_cases.title: Add one time purchase
use_cases.description: Implement a hosted checkout flow for single purchases in a mobile app.

use_cases.title: Harden webhook security
use_cases.description: Add signature verification and idempotent handling for Stripe webhooks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic checkout
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a minimal Stripe Checkout Session flow with success and cancel URLs and explain server and client steps.

prompt_templates.title: Payment intent UI
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a payment intent backend example and the matching Stripe.js confirmCardPayment flow.

prompt_templates.title: Subscription setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline subscription creation using a Price ID and return the client secret for the first invoice.

prompt_templates.title: Webhook hardening
prompt_templates.prompt: Give webhook verification and idempotent processing guidance with key events to handle.

output_examples.input: Explain a Stripe subscription flow and required webhooks.
output: Create customer and subscription using a Price ID
Return client secret for the first invoice payment
Verify webhook signatures for payment and cancellation events
Update access only after webhook confirmation

best_practices: Verify webhook signatures and use idempotency
Use test mode keys and Stripe test cards first
Store Stripe object IDs in your database
anti_patterns: Trusting client side payment status alone
Handling raw card data on your server
Skipping webhook events for subscription updates

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Stripe SDKs?
faq.answer: Examples are Python and JavaScript, but concepts apply to other Stripe SDKs.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and patterns, not running code or infrastructure setup.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my backend?
faq.answer: Map the patterns to your server framework and add your data persistence logic.

faq.question: Does it access or store my secrets?
faq.answer: No. It only provides guidance and does not handle secrets or API keys.

faq.question: What if webhook verification fails?
faq.answer: Check the endpoint secret, raw body handling, and the Stripe-Signature header.

faq.question: How does it compare to Stripe docs?
faq.answer: It condenses common flows into ready patterns and highlights key pitfalls.
